doc.after: The mourning dove is a medium-sized, slender dove approximately 31Â cm (12Â in) in length. Mourning doves weigh 112â170Â g (4.0â6.0Â oz), usually closer to 128Â g (4.5Â oz).[18] The elliptical wings are broad, and the head is rounded. Its tail is long and tapered ("macroura" comes from the Greek words for "large" and "tail"[19]). Mourning doves have perching feet, with three toes forward and one reversed. The legs are short and reddish colored. The beak is short and dark, usually a brown-black hue.[6]
